=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2014/05/13
Average Rating: 4.9
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Simon Langton'], 'Producers': ['Sue Birtwistle', 'Michael Wearing'], 'Starring': ['Alison Steadman', 'Julia Sawalha', 'Colin Firth'], 'Studio': ['Series']}
Review Text: This is my favorite movie to watch over and over and over.  I have seen most of the other versions of Pride and Prejudice and read the book; but this version is the 'best'.  It follows the book closely.  Every member of the cast is 'perfect.  I never get tired of seeing it again.
Review Title: I love it.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Swan (Remaster)
Review Date: 2014/12/31
Store: Grace Kelly  (Actor),     Alec Guinness  (Actor),     Charles Vidor  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, MGM Home Entertainment, All MGM Titles
Product Description: ["Grace Kelly is gloriously, glamorously regal in this retelling of Ferenc Molnar's romantic fable about a shy princess whose head tells her to wed a worldly Crown Prince (Alec Guinness), but whose heart is drawn to a dashing commoner (Louis Jourdan). Garbed in dreamy Helen Rose gowns, surrounded by Mittel-European opulence, the leading lady dances, duels, flirts, falls in love and makes even the most jaded moviegoer want to believe in fairy tales. And just to prove that fairy tales can come true, Kelly became a real-life princess as The Swan went into release, marrying Prince Rainier of Monaco in a magnificent royal wedding that captured the world's imagination."]
Average Rating: 4.3
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Full Screen, NTSC, Original recording remastered', 'Contributor': 'Alec Guinness, Grace Kelly, Charles Vidor, Agnes Moorehead, Van Dyke Parks, Estelle Winwood, Louis Jourdan, Jessie Royce Landis, Brian Aherne, Leo G. raw_response:
This individual's purchase history reflects a strong preference for quality storytelling, specifically enjoying adaptations that closely follow source materials, particularly classic literature. They frequently favor period dramas featuring renowned actors, indicating an appreciation for nostalgia and aesthetic. The ratings are often high for well-crafted films with notable performances, suggesting a tendency to value artistic quality and emotional impact in their viewing choices.

Conversely, they express dissatisfaction with films perceived as "preachy," overly dark, or poorly executed, consistently awarding low scores to these experiences. A clear dislike for subtitles indicates a preference for English-language content, which aligns with their high ratings for films with strong English dialogue. 

Overall, the purchasing behavior signifies a liking for drama, romance, and humor, and a tendency to critique films that do not meet their expectations for clarity and engaging plots. This person is likely drawn to character-driven stories with substantive dialogue and aesthetic fidelity to their themes.

target_interaction.title: Awful
target_interaction.text: Confusing, plotless, message agenda.  Don't waste your time.
